苹果首席执行官蒂姆·库克在 X 帖子中发表讲话，宣布公司对这一悲惨局势表示支持。苹果将​​向救援和恢复工作捐款。

我们的心与失去亲人的家庭以及受到毛伊岛和夏威夷大岛毁灭性野火影响的每个人同在。我们对所有第一批响应者深表感谢。苹果将​​捐款用于紧急救援和长期恢复工作。

随着当地人和游客成群结队地试图撤离，情况似乎很严峻。当地紧急救援人员称拉海纳镇“已被摧毁”。

一个家庭被野火包围，不得不通过iPhone 14上的 Apple 卫星紧急求救功能联系救援服务。不用说，在扑灭野火期间，所有前往毛伊岛和该地区的旅行都已被切断。

; Thu, 10 Aug 2023 22:48:31 GMT https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/08/10/apple-mls-season-pass-subscriptions-have-doubled-since-lionel-messi-joined-inter-miami https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/08/10/apple-mls-season-pass-subscriptions-have-doubled-since-lionel-messi-joined-inter-miami Wesley Hilliard Latest Intel and AMD vulnerabilities a gentle reminder to switch to Apple silicon

新威胁被称为“Downfall”和“Inception”，两者都依赖于推测执行，分别与 Meltdown 和Spectre 漏洞类似。它们都被描述为“中等”严重程度，其中 Downfall 影响英特尔芯片，Inception 针对 AMD 处理器。

截至目前，英特尔和 AMD 都已发布操作系统级微码软件更新，两家公司都致力于解决这两个漏洞。据Ars Technica 报道，两家公司还确认，他们尚未发现这两个漏洞存在任何利用情况。

然而，重要的是，一旦英特尔和 AMD 推出更新，制造商就应该发布自己的更新来解决这些问题。对于消费产品、服务器 CPU 和工作站来说，“垮台”和“开端”都是风险，因为这些产品都配备了多年的 Intel 或 AMD 处理器。

倒台

从各方面来看，“垮台”是这两个漏洞中较大的一个。它被称为“ CVE-2022-40982 ”，由 Google 安全研究员 Daniel Moghimi 概述。他是这样描述的：

“该漏洞是由英特尔处理器中的内存优化功能引起的，该功能无意中向软件泄露了内部硬件寄存器。这使得不受信任的软件可以访问其他程序存储的数据，而这些数据通常不应访问。我发现 Gather 指令旨在加速访问内存中的分散数据，在推测执行期间泄漏内部向量寄存器文件的内容。为了利用此漏洞，我介绍了收集数据采样（GDS）和收集值注入（GVI）技术。您可以阅读我写的论文了解更多详情。”

Moghimi 表示，Downfall 是 Meltdown 漏洞的“后继者”，因为它们都依赖推测执行来损害受影响的系统。

英特尔表示，所有基于 Skylake、Kaby Lake、Whiskey Lake、Ice Lake、Comet Lake、Coffee Lake、Rocket Lake 和 Tiger Lake 的处理器以及其他几代处理器都受到了 Downfall 的影响。这意味着 2015 年及以后生产的大多数芯片都会受到影响。

英特尔被幽灵困扰

不过，英特尔基于 Alder Lake 和 Raptor Lake 的最新第 12 代和第 13 代芯片不受影响。同时，Celeron、Pentium 和 Apollo 低端 CPU 也不受影响。

盗梦空间

Inception 也称为“ CVE-2023-20569 ”，它是 Spectre bug 的后代，它被描述为“在某些英特尔(R) 处理器的某些向量执行单元中瞬时执行后，通过微架构状态暴露信息可能会允许经过身份验证的用户可能会通过本地访问实现信息泄露。”

ETH Zrich 的 COSMEC 小组的安全研究人员指出，该漏洞可能会泄露一系列 AMD 处理器上的任意数据，包括 Ryzen、EPYC 和 Threadripper。该组织还发布了展示该漏洞的概念验证视频。

好消息是，这些漏洞已被英特尔和 AMD 解决，而且它们似乎都不像它们的衍生漏洞 Meltdown 和 Spectre 那样危险。

可能是升级到苹果芯片的好时机

尽管如此，这些普遍存在的漏洞还是在温和地提醒我们，苹果在处理器的选择上已经放弃了英特尔。该公司现在全面采用Apple Silicon ，这意味着它不需要担心像这样的英特尔或 AMD 漏洞。

苹果硅

值得注意的是，即使对于苹果芯片来说，仍然可能会出现一些漏洞。例如，“PacMan”缺陷与 2022 年的 Spectre 和 Meltdown 类似，尽管它并未对现实世界中的任何计算机造成严重损害。

位置服务允许应用程序确定和使用用户的位置或大致位置，以帮助他们提供相关服务。用户允许执行此操作的应用程序列在“系统设置”、“隐私和安全”、“位置服务”中。

然而， 2023 年 7 月 24 日发布的 macOS Ventura 版本中存在一个错误，导致一些用户根本看不到该部分中列出的任何应用程序。他们也无法查看哪些应用程序现在或最近正在使用其位置数据。

这与AppleInsider发现的macOS Sonoma测试版中的间歇性错误类似，其中“隐私和安全”的“辅助功能”部分中的应用程序有时也会消失。在这种情况下，出现问题的可能性更大，因为 macOS Sonoma 正处于 Beta 测试阶段，而且 Mac 的重启通常可以修复该问题。

对于 macOS Ventura 13.5 中的位置服务错误，重新启动 Mac 似乎无法解决该问题。

该问题最先由MacRumors发现。目前，苹果的支持论坛大约有两打有关该问题的报告，但还没有可行的解决方案。

苹果尚未对此事发表评论。

MicroLED 比 OLED 具有更高的亮度和更清晰的图像，据信苹果正在计划转向它。最初有报道称，该公司将开始在下一代Apple Watch Ultra 中使用它，然后扩展到大多数或所有设备上。

然而，据报道该计划随后被推迟，最近有消息称 Apple Watch Ultra 直到2026 年某个时候才会配备 microLED。据推测，延迟与生产良率问题有关，制造商 LG Display 似乎一直在努力克服这些问题。

据The Elec报道，LG Display 于 2023 年 6 月从台湾公司 Ultra Display Technology (UDT) 购买了14 项美国专利。虽然两家公司都没有发表评论，但未具体说明的行业消息人士称，所有 13 项注册专利和一项未决专利申请都涉及 microLED。

这些专利主要涉及所谓的转移过程，该过程需要将几十个芯片植入一个紧凑且特定的位置。 LG 已经购买了如何处理特别小的芯片的专利。

购买这些专利似乎并不会缩短将 microLED 引入 Apple Watch Ultra 所需的时间。虽然这些专利的消息直到今天才被披露，但收购是在 6 月份进行的。

当时首次听到有关 2026 年发布计划的报道，目前尚不清楚 LG 是否在获得专利后计算了其估计。

即使没有 microLED 显示屏，苹果预计也会在 2023 年晚些时候推出第二代Apple Watch Ultra。有传言称，新版本将比第一代更轻，并且可能有不同的颜色选择。

; Thu, 10 Aug 2023 14:38:46 GMT https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/08/10/lg-buys-patents-to-speed-up-bringing-microled-to-apple-watch-ultra https://appleinsider.com/articles/23/08/10/lg-buys-patents-to-speed-up-bringing-microled-to-apple-watch-ultra William Gallagher NuPhy Field75 Wireless Mechanical Gaming Keyboard review: Not your ordinary mechanical keyboard

如今的机械键盘通常采用类似的设计，但具有一项突出的功能。然而，NuPhy Field75 无线机械游戏键盘配备了多种组件，使其在竞争中脱颖而出。

NuPhy 键盘对于AppleInsider上的评测并不陌生。虽然我们评测过的这些产品之间并没有太大的不同，但 Field75 却处于完全不同的水平。

机械键盘非常值得拥有，因为它们在可定制的机身内提供舒适的打字体验。它们可以根据您的个人风格或办公桌布局进行配置。

虽然 Field75 提供流畅的打字体验，但它比办公室环境更适合游戏设置。

NuPhy Field75 无线机械游戏键盘 — 构造不同

NuPhy Field75 无线机械游戏键盘具有与传统键盘相同的底层功能。但是，您访问它们的方式可能会有所不同。

Field75 的尺寸为 14.66 x 5.62 x 1.59 英寸，配备 83 个按键。它遵循 ANSI（美国国家标准协会）键盘设计标准，宽度是传统键盘的 75%。

由于 Field75 对于无线键盘而言较重（重量为 2.81 磅），因此 NuPhy 在其上安装了一个金属把手，以便单手携带。然而，我们不打算带着 Field75 旅行，并计划将其放在我们的办公桌上。

与当今键盘上的传统音量按钮不同，Field75 具有音量控制旋钮。这本质上是一个机械轮，可以通过转动它来改变设备的音量。

然而，如果您喜欢使用音量按钮，它们仍然可以在 F10 至 F12 键中使用。

音量滚动旋钮、RGB 背光选择器和连接设置

右上角是三个指示灯。从上到下，这些将告诉您大写锁定是否打开、滚动锁定是否打开以及键盘是否正在充电。

充电指示灯可以在不同颜色之间变化，每种颜色都有不同的含义。

  • 蓝色 = 正在充电
  • 绿色 = 电池电量为 80% 或更高

苹果将​​收购迪士尼的传闻与 iPod 一样古老。而且，你可能认为分析师现在已经发现这种情况不会发生。

我们在 2022 年 11 月写了这篇文章的大部分内容，当时鲍勃·艾格 (Bob Iger) 在卸任三年后重新担任首席执行官。确实， 艾格表示，在那三年里，迪士尼和苹果之间的合并可能已经“达到了目标”。

只是，你必须忘记艾格也说过那是史蒂夫·乔布斯还活着的时候。非常具体地说，这两个人从未谈论过交易。

这显然不是一个重要的细节。至少，如果您是一位了解好标题的真正价值的金融分析师，则不会。

这就是苹果收购迪士尼的说法的根本原因。这是统计数据和财务分析，表明你说这件事将会发生会得到多少关注。

不会的。

一位曾为艾格工作的迪士尼内部人士于 2022 年 11 月告诉雅虎娱乐，“他（艾格）将出售公司。”“这是最终交易撮合者的巅峰交易。”

也许这真的是迪士尼内部人士。也许是有人穿着星球大战冲锋队服装路过。后者似乎是最有可能的，因为当他们射击时，他们也没有击中任何东西。

我们以前来过这里并且会继续回来

不管怎样，这只是一长串声称苹果肯定会收购迪士尼的最新消息，而且现在绝对会这样做。

Needham & Company 的娱乐和互联网分析师劳拉·马丁 (Laura Martin) 表示，问题在于耳机，笨蛋。

“你实际上不能强迫华特迪士尼公司专门为 Vision Pro 耳机或苹果制作内容，除非你拥有它，”她告诉 CNBC 。 “如果星球大战、皮克斯或漫威的创意内容人员不想这样做，他们就不必这样做。”

“因为迪士尼致力于制作能够最大化其所有内容收入流的内容，”她继续说道。 “如果苹果拥有[迪士尼]，它可以说，‘听着，我们想要 100,000 美元 3,500 美元的独家内容’，而且它实际上可以通过拥有迪士尼独家内容来推动 3,500 美元耳机的渗透，因为它们”他们是地球上最好的讲故事的人。”

马丁所说的一切并不是完全错误的。但按照同样的逻辑，电影院应该购买迪士尼，这样他们就可以获得独家电影，而不是看到所有内容都直接进入迪士尼+。

或者同样地，迪士尼应该从苹果购买 Vision Pro，因为这样它就可以确保将其内容传输到该设备上。

显然苹果现在应该收购迪士尼以使 Vision Pro 取得成功

迪士尼似乎在 Vision Pro 上做得很好。

艾格在 WWDC 上表示：“我们非常自豪能够再次与世界上最伟大的故事讲述公司与世界上最具创新性的技术公司合作，为您带来现实生活中的魔法，我很高兴地宣布Disney+ 将于第一天上线。”

这并不是分析师劳拉·马丁第一次表示苹果绝对必须收购迪士尼，也不是她第一次在苹果自己应该意识到这一点之后才这么说。不过，通常情况下，她和其他许多人都会说，流媒体和 Apple TV+ 意味着苹果今天绝对必须收购迪士尼。

运行数字

有一次，一位分析师确实做了一些数学计算。 2017 年，分析师阿米特·达里亚纳尼 (Amit Daryanani) 表示，“一系列事件的结合”意味着苹果应该收购迪士尼。

那是“应该”，而不是“意愿”，但达里亚纳尼听起来好像蒂姆·库克不这样做就是个白痴。而且——请记住，这是 2017 年——达里亚纳尼的计算表明，苹果将不得不承担巨额债务才能做到这一点。

目前，华特迪士尼公司的市值为 1754 亿美元。据Investors.com称，苹果公司拥有约 2000 亿美元的现金储备，该网站还认为该公司应该将现金储备交给投资者，即“合法所有者”，而不是收购公司。

因此，从表面上看，苹果有钱收购迪士尼，无论削减这么多现金储备是否明智。实际上，苹果收购迪士尼也不会花费 1754 亿美元，甚至会更多。

你不能按照公司现在看起来的价值来购买它，或者公司没有理由让你购买它。不过，我们还是假设苹果公司能够以低于其 2000 亿美元零钱的价格收购迪士尼。

史蒂夫·乔布斯和鲍勃·艾格，2007 年

重要的不仅仅是价格标签

还有一个稍微重要的事实是迪士尼没有真正的理由想要出售。公司可能会受到股东的压力而被迫出售，但总的来说，从整体来看，迪士尼表现良好。

而且，虽然粉丝们仍然对查佩克的离开感到兴奋，但这可能更多是因为董事会想要赚更多的钱，以及公司有一个新冠替罪羊，因为他主要是在实施艾格制定的项目。艾格没有回来与苹果达成协议。

是的，迪士尼有几年表现不佳，也犯过一些代价高昂、引人注目的失误。当然，还有新冠疫情，导致公园关闭了一段时间，并削减了更长时间的容量。

不过，更可预见的是，其迪士尼+流媒体服务将被证明既取得了巨大成功，同时也存在一些问题。

自《威利汽船》以来，迪士尼已经取得了长足的进步，现在包括了《星球大战》的全部内容。

Disney+ 的两个方面

The Disney+ streaming service launched in November 2019 and aimed to get between 60 million and 90 million subscribers by 2024.

Instead, it easily beat that by November 2020, after just one year instead of five. (It's intended to be watched on TVs, iPhones and iPads, but you can also watch on a Mac .)

The problem is that the service is still in its early days when it requires investment in technology as much as anything else. Then while it has an enviably gigantic library of material, what drives new subscribers the most is brand-new programming.

And there is little that is more expensive than television programming with, for instance, "The Mandalorian" alone costing around $15 million per episode to produce. There are then other costs such as marketing, and other income such as from toys and the parks themselves, that are not counted at all in the streamer's accounts, but rather in the accounting of the company as a whole.

Disney knew it would lose money with streaming at first, and its financial earnings calls have continually forecast it. But it didn't expect to lose $1.5 billion because of it in the last quarter, up from about $1.1 billion a quarter ago, and $630 billion in the year-ago quarter.

This is complex, of course, more so than the numbers suggest at a first glance. The losses are tied to overseas sporting withdrawal, and impairment charges related to taking content off the service.

Even so, Disney+ is this massive success that is costing its owner much more than expected. It did very recently raise costs on Disney+ streaming, and it is doing to again on August 10.

Maybe, if you look at it just the wrong way, Disney could conceivably, possibly be the slightest bit vulnerable. Any firm buying it would be taking on the same problems and the same costs.

At present, those problems include the strikes by the Writers' Guild of America and of the actors' union, SAG-AFTRA. Usually an adept executive, Bob Iger accused writers of being unrealistic in their demands for a fair wage, and he did so while at a billionaire's retreat.

Iger has now tried to atone for that by saying how much Disney values creatives, but the company also removed major series from Disney+ solely in order to save on paying royalties to them. Consequently, even without Iger's tone-deaf attitude during the strike, there will now be writers and actors who will necessarily bring their projects to other studios first.

Doing what firms do best

Nonetheless, before the strike Needham analyst Laura Martin argued that Disney is great at making shows, while Apple is great at getting to audiences. Therefore, she insisted in May 2023, not only is Apple able to buy Disney, such an acquisition is necessary to make Apple TV+ competitive.

"So I think Apple is really doing a very mediocre job of streaming," she said on CNBC . "They just said they were gonna do a billion dollars in film finance [but] this is sort of laughable, because these companies they're competing with in content businesses are spending thirty billion dollars a year."

"Even Netflix, which is a single line business and streaming is spending $20 billion in round numbers," she continued. "So the notion that Apple is going to spend $2 billion on streaming and $1 billion on films, I think they're starting to get serious because what they're realizing is that services and hardware, which they've done today, actually do create consumer lock-in, but so does content."

"And the only content that you don't have to license every time you want to use it is if you own the IP, you own the intellectual property underneath it," said Martin. "And guess what the Walt Disney Company has? One hundred years of some of the best intellectual property, characters, and film franchises on Earth."

Martin is right about content, but it's not that this has suddenly become a new thing. Apple TV+ has been running since 2019, but it was in the works for years before that.

At one point it was rumored that Apple was in talks to buy MGM to get its library of content, but if that were true, it didn't happen.

Not only has Apple not bought MGM — nor Imagine Entertainment, at one point also reportedly in the frame — but it hasn't bought any studio. That doesn't mean it won't, but four years after launch, Apple is clearly not seeing acquiring a library to be a priority.

And then there is also this. Amazon bought MGM in a deal costing $8.45 billion .

Only Amazon knows whether it has added enough subscribers to pay for that, but outside of the business, it's likely that few viewers noticed the difference.

Laura Martin is right that content helps lock in viewers, and she's right that Apple could afford to buy Disney. But that does not make this the slam dunk she implies.

For one thing, as deep as Apple gets into streaming, it is still doing it to sell iPhones, it is not banking the business on getting the biggest audience for "Schmigadoon!" that it can.

Plus you can have the money to buy a firm the size and stature of Disney, but that doesn't mean it's easy.

It's not just up to Disney and Apple

Say Tim Cook burns to see more episodes of "Mandalorian," and Bob Iger is keen to see an Apple logo on Cinderella's Castle in the Magic Kingdom. The two firms are still so huge that any kind of deal would have to go to US regulators.

And that is precisely where the latest crop of rumors in August 2023 have sprung from. It's as if it's taken months for analysts to realize the size of the firms was a problem — and then to bafflingly come to the conclusion there that an apparent solution is to cut down Disney.

The Hollywood Reporter says many analysts this position . If Disney sheds some of its many companies, they believe, it would make it easy for Apple to buy it.

It is true that Iger has referred to ABC and ESPN as Disney firms that "may not be core" to the company's business. Disney could sell off those channels, if it could find a buyer that would agree to terms which reportedly require Disney still controlling the brands. It could conceivably divest itself of any parts of the company, right down to its Disney Land and Disney World resorts if it wanted to.

Apple might want parts of ESPN. It might also want parts of ABC, but that's less certain. Apple does not historically buy struggling parts of businesses, nor is it that interested in being second-fiddle to another company controlling the property.

There comes a point for Disney where this becomes practically asset-stripping. What's left may be a smaller Disney, but it's also one that has lost some of its attraction.

Plus it's unlikely that Disney could winnow away itself enough that the government would wave through a sale. Most recently, a US judge refused to allow much smaller publishing houses Penguin Books and its rival Simon & Schuster to merge, in what Reuters says was merely a $2.2 billion deal.

In that case, the argument was that merging these two firms would cut competition, and also lower advances for their authors. Disney might want to lower what it pays creatives, but even before dissing them on the picket line and removing their shows from existence, that's what got it into costly hot water with actor Scarlett Johansson.

Bob Iger and his (short-lived) replacement as Disney CEO, Bob Chapek

Apple doesn't buy firms on a whim

We've all spent more on something than we should, just because we wanted it. But we're not Apple, which has no reason to want Disney, ESPN, or ABC other than how that would balloon out its Apple TV+ library.

Apple's had the chance to buy libraries of content before, and even reportedly held some preliminary discussions with MGM. But it passed on that deal, and hasn't introduced any others.

Steve Jobs bought Pixar from Lucasfilm because the price was right. Disney bought Pixar because its animation studios were no longer creating the hits that it needed. And then Disney bought Lucasfilm because George Lucas was ready and the price looked good.

So huge companies will buy other huge companies, but only when the price is less than the value they will get from it, and they believe that the regulators won't get in the way. Disney is not ready to be part of a larger synergy machine than its own, nor does Apple appear to have any inclination to get into the theme park business, even in part.

Disney is still not in a weak enough position to make it a bargain for Apple, nor does it have anything Apple especially needs.

But still not good for Apple.

The demo shows Windows XP booting up to its desktop and so far not running any Windows apps. UTM notes that it doesn't yet connect to keyboards or other input devices, so it's not a practical system yet.

UTM Virtual Machines for Mac is intended for Apple users to be able to install many different versions of Windows, or Linux, and so have access to the massive array of apps written for those platforms.

"UTM employs Apple's Hypervisor virtualization framework to run ARM64 operating systems on Apple Silicon at near native speeds," says the company on its website . "In addition, lower performance emulation is available to run x86/x64 on Apple Silicon as well as ARM64 on Intel."

One casualty of Apple's move from Intel processors to its own Apple Silicon was that Mac dropped its Boot Camp feature. This was the ability to reboot a Mac and have it running Windows natively.

In February 2023, the Parallels company managed to get its Desktop app running Windows 11 on Apple Silicon.

SOS via Satellite has only been active since November 2022, but it has been credited for many rescues already. The feature automatically becomes available when no other communication options appear.

According to an X post from Michael Miraflor first seen by 9to5Mac , a family of five were caught inside their vehicle with no means of escape as the Maui wildfire burned around them. At least one passenger had an iPhone 14, which allowed them to contact emergency responders.

The X post embedded below contains the text conversation that occurred after getting a signal via satellite. Expand the image — it's a long one.

我哥哥的女朋友的表弟和他的家人在毛伊岛被困在车里，而他们周围突然爆发了野火。

没有手机服务，因此 Apple Emergency SOS 是他们与急救人员取得联系的唯一方式。确实挽救了他们的生命。 pic.twitter.com/PpxNwTGOAf

— Michael J. Miraflor (@michaelmiraflor) August 10, 2023

When activating SOS via Satellite, users are prompted to answer a few questions about the situation so it can all be sent in a bundle to responders. This reduces the time it takes emergency personnel to assess the situation since sending each message could take several minutes.

According to the text history, five people were trapped in a van near an outlet mall in Maui. It took responders about thirty minutes to arrive and rescue them.

SOS via Satellite has been used in many life-saving situations. A few instances involved getting people off of a mountain , and one helped draw attention to a wildfire fight off of a lake.

Despite dramatic helicopter rescue footage at the iPhone 14 launch event causing some eye rolls, it seems SOS via Satellite is performing exactly as Apple advertised. The service has been slowly rolling out globally, is less accurate towards the poles, and is free for the first two years.
